alert.note: Alert for Fort Bend; Inland Brazoria (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 24 at 2:16PM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Fort Bend and north central Brazoria Counties through 245 PM CDT... At 215 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Greatwood, or near First Colony, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Sugar Land, southwestern Missouri City, eastern Rosenberg, Richmond, First Colony, Iowa Colony, Fairchilds, Bonney, Thompsons, Sienna, Greatwood, New Territory, Riverstone, Brazos Bend State Park, Juliff and Rosharon. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
